intro: Velleia montana, commonly known as mountain velleia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Velleia montana is often found in rocky or forested habitats at higher elevations.
